definition: the activity of operating something such as a machine or business
details:
noun
- the activity of operating something such as a machine or business
= example: the activity of operating something such as a machine or business
- a planned activity involving many people performing various actions
= example: a planned activity involving many people performing various actions
- a process or series of acts especially of a practical or mechanical nature involved in a particular form of work
= example: a process or series of acts especially of a practical or mechanical nature involved in a particular form of work
= synonyms: procedure
- a medical procedure involving an incision with instruments
= synonyms: surgery, surgical operation, surgical procedure, surgical process
- (mathematics) calculation by mathematical methods
= synonyms: mathematical process, mathematical operation
- activity by a military or naval force (as a maneuver or campaign)
= example: activity by a military or naval force (as a maneuver or campaign)
= synonyms: military operation
- a business especially one run on a large scale
= example: a business especially one run on a large scale
- (psychology) the performance of some composite cognitive activity
= example: (psychology) the performance of some composite cognitive activity
= synonyms: process
- (computer science) data processing in which the result is completely specified by a rule (especially the processing that results from a single instruction)
= example: (computer science) data processing in which the result is completely specified by a rule (especially the processing that results from a single instruction)
- process or manner of functioning or operating
= example: process or manner of functioning or operating
= synonyms: functioning, performance
- the state of being in effect or being operative
= example: the state of being in effect or being operative
